Author: everything_is_bad

Comment: The higher you rise, the further you fall.  A lot of people respected Musk in the same way they respected Thomas Edison: he might be a thief and an abuser, who built his empire on the backs of others and stole their credit, but at least he got impressive achievements for his companies, and moved a lot of technology forward. It's the kind of strength certain people respect, even if unfairly earned. You know, the "he's a rough cop, but he gets results" kind of respect.  Meanwhile, Trump didn't even do that: he just took his daddy's money and burned it. Trump doesn't have a single legacy policy or achievement under his belt. Demagoguery is his only public skill, and he's not intelligent enough to even have the grasp of a coherent political agenda. Trump is not a "bad cop who gets results", he's a bad cop that beats up innocents who aren't even suspects, all while failing to solve a single crime. Even the "tough on crime" crowd doesn't respect that kind of cop.  Many people you see angry at Musk on Reddit, don't truly "hate" Trump, the same way you can't hate a steaming pile of shit you stepped into. Because you can't truly hate something that doesn't have agency. You just wipe your foot and move on. Trump is a narcissistic moron acting like a narcissistic moron, end of story. Expecting him to act otherwise is like expecting a snake not to bite, or a wasp not to sting.  Musk, though, is different. While he is not the genius his fans portray, he *is* intelligent enough to be fully aware of his own actions and their consequences on others. This makes his recent actions much more of a true betrayal for many, worthy of true hate. The things Musk had said and done turned him from a second Thomas Edison to a second Henry Ford, and while both of them did bad things, the latter, being an open Nazi sympathizer, was objectively more evil. Even in today's polarized America, there are still a lot of people who are OK with a ruthless industrialist, but *not* OK with a Nazi.
Author: GeneReddit123

But we shouldn't have a businessman shape the country, because empathy is an important quality that many successful businesspeople lack.
